title: BLOCKER: Spotify Web API queue removal limitation
description: The Spotify Web API does not provide endpoints to remove songs from the queue. Only read and add operations are available. This prevents clear_queue() implementation. Need to choose a workaround: (1) use start_playback to restart, (2) skip through queue repeatedly, (3) switch to Playlist-based approach, or (4) document as limitation.

title: Task 4: Queue Sync Engine
description: Create queue_sync.py with QueueSync class. Add queue modification methods to SpotifyClient (clear_queue, add_songs_to_queue). Implement title/artist to Spotify ID lookup with error handling. Test sync manually.

title: Task 3: LLM API Client (OpenRouter)
description: Create llm_client.py with OpenRouter integration. Implement system prompt, API calls, JSON response parsing. Test with manual script.

title: Task 6: CLI Loop & Main Application
description: Modify main.py to implement the main CLI loop. Initialize all clients (SpotifyClient, LLMClient, QueueSync, ConversationHistory). Implement infinite loop with user input, queue fetching, LLM calls, queue sync, and conversation storage. Add exit handling and error handling.

title: Task 5: Conversation History Management
description: Create conversation.py with ConversationHistory class. Implement add_user_message, add_assistant_response, get_history (formatted for LLM), and clear methods. Test manually.

title: Task 7: Polish & Edge Cases
description: Handle empty queue responses, song lookup failures (log warning and skip), add user feedback messages, test edge cases (clear queue, non-existent songs, network errors, malformed responses). Improve robustness.

title: Task 4.5: Just-in-Time Queue Injection System
description: Implement JIT queue injection to solve Spotify queue removal API limitation. Maintain shadow queue in Python and inject next song 10-20 seconds before current song ends. Create QueueManager, enhance SpotifyClient with JIT methods, rewrite QueueSync for JIT, and thoroughly test.
